alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Hardin (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 02 at 10:50PM CST until further notice by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Tennessee... Tennessee River at Savannah For the Tennessee River...including Pickwick Dam, Savannah, Saltillo, Perryville, Johnsonville...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tennessee River at Savannah. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 376.0 feet, Wilkinson Ferry Drive is flooded near the river. Resort lots by the edge of the Tennessee River are beginning to flood along Wilkinson Ferry Drive across from Saltillo. Access to Bridgeview Estates from the northeast is cut off due to flooding just south of Highway 64. The evacuation route from the camper sites on the south end of Riverside Lane in Crump is flooding. Water on Coffee Landing Road is just north of Lemert Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 375.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 PM CST Wednesday was 376.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 370.4 feet Thursday, March 10. - Flood stage is 370.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
